clinical_study.brief_title: ELRIAH Score: A Simple Score for HCC Risk Stratification in CHC Patients With Cirrhosis or Advanced Liver Fibrosis Who Achieved SVR Following DAA Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: ELRIAH Score: A Simple Score for HCC Risk Stratification in CHC Patients With Cirrhosis or Advanced Liver Fibrosis Who Achieved SVR Following DAA Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: aimed to develop a scoring system to assess risk of developing HCC in a large cohort of chronic hepatitis C (CHC) patients with advanced hepatic fibrosis (F3) or cirrhosis (F4) with sustained virological response (SVR) after receiving direct acting antivirals (DAAs).

detailed_description.textblock: Current guidelines recommend biannual surveillance for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in all patients with cirrhosis. However, risk of HCC incidence is not the same for different patients. The study aimed to develop a scoring system to assess risk of developing HCC in a large cohort of chronic hepatitis C (CHC) patients with advanced hepatic fibrosis (F3) or cirrhosis (F4) with sustained virological response (SVR) after receiving direct acting antivirals (DAAs).

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of HCC incidence after viral clearance

study_pop.textblock: 2326 CHC patients (638 patients with F3 and 1734 with F4 stage)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- no history of previous HCC
- SVR after DAAs treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of previous HCC
